articles.author: Alexandra Sternlicht
articles.title: Coronavirus Found In Semen: Can It Be Sexually Transmitted? - Forbes
articles.description: A new study found COVID-19 in semen of male patients.
articles.content:
Coronavirus was found in semen of recovering and acute male COVID-19 patients in a small study conducted in January and February in China, though it remains unknown, according to the CDC, whether the disease can be transmitted sexually.
It is unknown whether… [+2496 chars]

articles.author: Sally Murrer
articles.title: Today is the sixth day without a Covid-19 death at Milton Keynes hospital - Milton Keynes Citizen
articles.description: For the sixth day running, no patients have died of coronavirus at MK hospital.
articles.content:
This time last month the hospital was losing an average of two or three patients a day to the virus, so the decrease is a sign that the city is over the peak.
Care home deaths are reported separately by the Office for National Statistics (ONS), and currently… [+775 chars]

articles.title: Four more coronavirus cases in Northumberland as two more patients die at county's NHS trust - Northumberland Gazette
articles.description: Two more people have died from coronavirus at the main hospital trust serving Northumberland as two new cases are confirmed across the county.
articles.content:
A total of 168 patients have died of covid-19 at the Northumbria Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust following figures released by NHS England.
The nationwide death toll, meanwhile, increased by 210 on Monday, May 11, to 32,065.
